item.title: Theory: Q-learning
item.description: Consider an MDP with finite state space \(\ALPHABET X\) and action space \(\ALPHABET U\), where \(|\ALPHABET X| = n\) and \(|\ALPHABET U| = m\). Recall the value iteration algorithm for infinite horizon MDPs. We start with an arbitrary initial \(V_0\) and then recursively compute \(V_{k+1} = \mathcal B V_k\). We first observe that the value iteration can be written in terms of the \(Q\)-function rather than the value function as follows: start with an arbitrary initial \(Q_0\) and the recursively compute \[ \begin{equation} \label{eq:Q} Q_{k+1}(x,u) = c(x,u) + Î² \sum_{y \in \ALPHABET X} P_{xy}(u) \min_{w \in \ALPHABET U} Q_k(y,w), \qquad x \in \ALPHABET X, u \in \ALPHABET U, k \ge 0 \end{equation} \]
